website_summaries.verdict: This suit's tight gaskets keep you dry during watersports, but its relaxed athletic cut doesn't restrict your movement. It provides some warmth, and can be paired with insulating clothing for late-season kayaking.
pros: MasterSeal waterproof cross-chest entry and relief zippers.Duraseal latex neck is neoprene coated
Wrist gaskets with adjusting neoprene overcuffs
cons: The neck gasket is intended to be tight enough to keep out water, but it might be too constrictive for men with larger necks

customer_reviews.title: Santa suit
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the suit. No leaks in the slightest. Spent a lot of time in the water training rescuers how to use throw bags.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Huntoon

customer_reviews.title: I like it!
customer_reviews.text: As a big man its hard to find properly sized whitewater gear. This xxl is perfect for my 6'5" 285lb build. I have a 53" chest and this thing fits great. I have plenty of room for my immersion research fleece paddling suit on under it too. Only complaint is the tightness of tge neck gasket. I have a huge neck and its difficult getting it properly stretched. Stohquist has EXCELLENT customer service too. I recommend this suit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Dry Suit at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suit because I wanted to be able to Kayak and fish all winter safely and didn't want to spend over a grand for a suit. This suit is perfect for my needs. I wore it 4 days on a 50 mile kayak trip down the beautiful Buffalo River and it was great. I was dry an warm in the cold and rain and when the sun did come out, the suit breaths to keep me comfortable. I highly recommend this suit.
customer_reviews.author: Dale E East

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this when I ended up in 55 degree water mile offshore
customer_reviews.text: It's a good suit... not a big fan of the socks but other than that it's very sturdy... be sure to wax the zipper before using it... I have a a Hydrus 2.5 semidry suit and this is a lot heavier and tougher built plus the latex gaskets are so much more comfortable... I had it on one time for 24 straight and it was comfortable...
customer_reviews.author: mountaineer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it in water yet but it fits and I can get it on and off by myself. The zippers work.
customer_reviews.author: JuneauReader

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Winter time on Lake Tahoe can get chilly, this suit takes the chill off.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great suit comfy
customer_reviews.text: Feels like pjs when you have it on. 40 and 50 degree water you barley feel with the proper base layers to keep warm. On a hot day just put my feet in the water while fishing
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great dry suit excellent shipper
customer_reviews.text: I wore this drive through during a trip through the Grand Canyon lasted three weeks. Performed flawlessly. I would highly recommend it to anyone. Easily as good as a Kokatat
customer_reviews.author: Billy Brown

customer_reviews.title: Warm
customer_reviews.text: We install docks in Maine lakes in the spring time. The water temperature is about 40, this suit does well, you still get cold after about an hour in the water. But it’s nice to get out and you are dry.
customer_reviews.author: Al Belanger

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still need to test but it has a good fit.
customer_reviews.author: Bay Reader

customer_reviews.title: Great suit!
customer_reviews.text: Great suit. The Medium size is a bit smaller than the Kokotat suit. This provides a reasonable alternative rather than ordering a custom suit. A great price. Beautifully made. Wonderful details.
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: The drysuit is very comfortable and doesn't interfere with my kayaks back band (Jackson ...
customer_reviews.text: Gaskets are tight, but the suit fits really well with my body (5'8'' 160 pounds, Athletic build). The drysuit is very comfortable and doesn't interfere with my kayaks back band (Jackson Fun). I have rolled in this suit and swam in this suit on purpose to test it out. It is very dry and keeps you warm in very low temperatures. For the price this suit is a good beginners drysuit and should last you a few good seasons of kayaking.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: I purchased the drysuit for my 16 year old son ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the drysuit for my 16 year old son to wear sailing in the late winter/spring season. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: And of sellers that may make it look like they have a different product
customer_reviews.text: Neck so small that would not go over my head. If i had forced it on I would have had to find someone to delicately cut off. Rather a dangerous solution Beware of this manufacturer. And of sellers that may make it look like they have a different product. A horrible and dangerous product by this manufacturer no matter what sellers call it
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Landon

product_meta.title: Stohlquist Amp Drysuit with Tunnel Drysuit
product_meta.description: The Amp features Stohlquist's new 4-layer drywear fabric--Twin Sensor. The four layer fabric features the best DWR treatments, durable nylon shell fabrics and waterproof/breathable treatments to provide the ultimate in protection and comfort. The Amp features a new softer latex neck and wrist gasket with more UV resistance and greater tear resistance. Breathable fabric drysocks are comfortable, easy to enter and universally sized. Sleek and articulated armored knees. Arm and thigh pockets are standard and well placed for limited interference and easy access. Double tunnel for sprayskirt integration.
feature_bullets: MasterSeal waterproof cross-chest entry and relief zippers
Neoprene coated Duraseal latex neck and wrist gaskets with adjustable neoprene wrist over-cuffs
Attached, universal fit fabric drysocks, built-in tunnel, zippered arm pocket, reflective panels
Cordura reinforced seat and knees with mesh drainers and articulated armored knees
